page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area coverd by our grid squares contains parts of three villages _Ickford,Worminghall and Shabbington.All these villages are fairly small (Ickford is the largest and has a population of 500) The houses are a mixture of old and fairly new.Many of the old houses are thatched.The villages are fairly quiet and pleasant to live in.Around the villages most of the land is fairly flat farmland _ some used for cattle and some for crops, particularly wheat. There are no factories or large shops in our area and most people have to go outside the villages to places like Oxford and Aylesbury for work or shopping.
